ns2:group.ns2:title: Why Building New Proteins from Scratch Is Our New Superpower | David Baker | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
The rapidly evolving field of protein design is revealing solutions to some of the worldâ€™s greatest problems, whether it's blocking a virus, breaking down a pollutant or creating brand-new materials. In conversation with TEDâ€™s Whitney Pennington Rodgers, biochemist David Baker explores his teamâ€™s Nobel Prize-winning work using AI to design new proteins with functions never before seen in nature â€” achieving breakthroughs that have fundamentally changed the future of science. (This conversation was part of an exclusive TED Membership event. TED Membership is the best way to support and engage with the big ideas you love from TED. To learn more, visit ted.com/membership.) ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Enhancing NFL Player Health and Safety with AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Enhancing NFL Player Health and Safety with AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
AWS OnAir's Nick Betz travelled to Philadelphia for the 2025 NFL Season Kickoff to learn how AWS and the NFL team up to continuously innovate in the world of football. In this clip, Nick meets with Mackenzie Herzog from the NFL to discuss how the NFL and AWS team up every year with technology like the Digital Athlete to make the game safer for players.
You can learn more about the Digital Athlete here: https://awsonair.net/Digital-Athlete

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]How to enter the 2025 Big Data Bowl | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: How to enter the 2025 Big Data Bowl | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Did you know that you could have a hand in creating the next, NFL Next Gen Stat? Join the 2025 Big Data Bowl to have your own ideas heard! You could see your stat come to live for football fans around the world - Shannon Brazil of the AWS Training and Certification team walks you through how to enter for your chance to win.
Get involved with the Big Data Bowl yourself this year by clicking this link: https://awsonair.net/2025-BigDataBowl

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Making NFL Next Gen Stats with AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Making NFL Next Gen Stats with AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
AWS OnAir's Nick Betz travelled to Philadelphia for the 2025 NFL Season Kickoff to learn how AWS and the NFL team up to continuously innovate in the world of football. In this clip, Josh Helmrich from the NFL Next Gen Stats team talks with Nick about how stats are created, and what role AWS plays in bringing them to life for fans every weekend.
You can learn more about the latest Next Gen Stats here: https://awsonair.net/NextGenStats2025

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Making the NFL Schedule with AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Making the NFL Schedule with AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
AWS OnAir's Nick Betz travelled to Philadelphia for the 2025 NFL Season Kickoff to learn how AWS and the NFL team up to continuously innovate in the world of football. In this clip, Nick meets with the NFL's Mike North to discuss how the schedule is made each year to give fans and players the best season possible, and the AWS technology behind the whole process!
To learn more about the schedule-making process, read this blog: https://awsonair.net/ScheduleCreation

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Metagenomi accelerates the search for cures to genetic diseases using AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Metagenomi accelerates the search for cures to genetic diseases using AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Metagenomi is working to transform the future of genetic medicine by leveraging the power of AWS and nature to discover potentially curative gene editing therapies. They worked with the AWS Prototyping team to scale their AI capabilities to analyze their entire database of 15+ billion proteins from the start of their discovery process. Using Guidance for Protein Folding on AWS, and services like AWS Batch and Inferentia, Metagenomi has accelerated the speed it takes to find the right proteins â€” at about a fifth of what it cost previously. Partnering with AWS has accelerated Metagenomiâ€™s efforts to fundamentally change how we treat genetic diseases â€” from simply managing symptoms, to potentially curing the underlying causes.
Learn more: Guidance for Protein Folding on AWS: http://go.aws/4owjrzj AWS Architecture Blog: http://go.aws/3JbCRdu

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Accelerating generative AI training at scale with SageMaker HyperPod | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Accelerating generative AI training at scale with SageMaker HyperPod | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
At Salesforce, building powerful generative AI models requires a laser focus on performance, scale, and iteration speed. But training these models is compute- intensive, and orchestrating thousands of GPUs used to be a major operational challenge. With Amazon SageMaker HyperPod, Salesforce now taps into what feels like a supercomputer at their fingertips. The managed service enables rapid, large-scale deployment of training infrastructureâ€”turning isolated nodes into a high-performance GPU fabric. By eliminating DevOps overhead and offering advanced training stack recipes out of the box (FSDP + LoRA + context parallel), HyperPod dramatically accelerates model training cycles, helping Salesforce innovate faster for their customers.
Learn more on how Salesforce is innovating with AWS: http://go.aws/3Jk1Yeh

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]This TED Talk Is Full of Bad Ideas | Gabe Whaley | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: This TED Talk Is Full of Bad Ideas | Gabe Whaley | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
What if the worst ideas turned out to be the most interesting? Mischief-making artist Gabe Whaley shares how he built a collective of artists whose seemingly bad ideas â€” like selling 5,000 keys to the same car â€” often go viral and sell for thousands of dollars. His playful experiments show why itâ€™s worth leaning into the absurd â€¦ because you never know what might happen. (Recorded at TED2025 on April 9, 2025)
Join us in person at a TED conference: https://tedtalks.social/events Become a TED Member to support our mission: https://ted.com/membership Subscribe to a TED newsletter: https://ted.com/newsletters
Follow TED! X: https://www.twitter.com/TEDTalks Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ted Facebook: https://facebook.com/TED LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/ted-conferences TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@tedtoks
The TED Talks channel features talks, performances and original series from the world's leading thinkers and doers. Subscribe to our channel for videos on Technology, Entertainment and Design â€” plus science, business, global issues, the arts and more. Visit https://TED.com to get our entire library of TED Talks, transcripts, translations, personalized talk recommendations and more.
Watch more: https://go.ted.com/gabewhaley
https://youtu.be/hn3vHUpIyhE

ns2:group.ns2:title: OpenAI Codex in your code editor
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Use Codex right in your code editor with the new IDE extension for VS Code, Cursor and other forks.
In this video, Gabriel Peal and Romain Huet show you how to explore code, implement new features, and brainstorm front-end design ideas for their app.
Timestamps:
00:00 Intro 00:45 Exploring the codebase 01:20 Implementing hover states 02:40 Moving tasks to Codex cloud 03:23 Brainstorming new designs with Codex 04:20 How Codex changed Gabrielâ€™s workflow 05:30 Reviewing Codexâ€™s work
Try it yourself:
VS Code: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=openai.chatgpt
Cursor, Windsurf, others: search OpenAI Codex in the extension directory
Learn more: Codex: openai.com/codex Developer docs: developers.openai.com/codex Code for OpenAI.fm: https://github.com/openai/openai-fm

ns2:group.ns2:title: My dog lost 19 pounds!
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Five years ago, Ellie began to slow down. Sheâ€™d nap more, skip walks, and we figured she was just getting older.
Then the vet told us Ellie was overweight, which was crazy because we didnâ€™t even realize it.
It turns out she was part of the 59% of adult dogs who are overweight or obese, which can shorten a dogâ€™s life by up to two and a half years. That was a huge wake-up call for us.
We took a closer look at what we were feeding her and realized her old kibble was ultra-processed and missing the nutrients she needed. That moment set us on a path to find something healthier that actually fit our lifestyle.
Spot & Tangoâ€™s UnKibble has been that solution. Ellieâ€™s lost 19 pounds, her energy is off the charts, and sheâ€™s truly living her happiest and healthiest life.
If your dog could benefit from losing a few pounds or youâ€™re simply looking to make a positive change, UnKibble is a great place to start. The promo GOLDEN will save you 60% off your first order.
#spotandtangopartner @spotandtango #goldenretrieverlife #dog #food

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [The Verge]The real story behind Apple's chip bump | The Vergecast

ns2:group.ns2:title: The real story behind Apple's chip bump | The Vergecast
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Nilayâ€™s back! And you can listen to The Vergecast with no ads, if youâ€™re a Verge subscriber! Big week, really. Nilay and David start the show by talking about ads, podcasts, platforms, and subscriptions. Then they talk a bunch about Appleâ€™s new M5-powered MacBook, iPad, and Vision Pro, and whether a chip bump is worth getting excited about. After that, Nilay reflects on a summer of using AI products, and explains why you can tell the whole story of this generation of AI just by talking about the smart home. Finally, in the lightning round, the hosts talk about AI song covers, Apple TV, TiVo, Roku, Cybertrucks, and the exploding Pixel 10 Pro Fold. #Vergecast #Podcast #Technology
